thread.title: The Daily Heat Index: Beyonce Electrifies This Halloween as X-Men's 'Storm'
thread.title_full: The Daily Heat Index: Beyonce Electrifies This Halloween as X-Men's 'Storm' | Maxim

author: Maxim Staff
title: The Daily Heat Index: Beyonce Electrifies This Halloween as X-Men's 'Storm'
text:
Here's a daily dose of what's heating up the internet:
Shock and Awe
In typical 'Yonce' fashion, the singer and all-around goddess pulled out all the stops this past weekend at Ciara's superhero themed birthday party. Channeling her inner X-Man, Beyonce went all out as weather-controlling mutant Storm, donning a white wig with intense colored contacts to match. Since Halloween isn't for another few days, who knows what other creative costumes we'll see before then, but this was definitely a great way to start. Let the 'Beyonce in a Superhero Movie' petitions again. You've got our vote.
Beyonce as Storm is the superhero movie we need pic.twitter.com/PU7XMNwMzn
â€” Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) October 25, 2015
Might We See Elle Woods Again?
Yes, Reese Witherspoon just dropped the bomb that you may live to see a Supreme Court Woods. In theaters, that is. On an episode of Fashionably Late on Lifetime, the famously golden locked actress hinted that she might be game for a third installment of Legally Blonde . "I actually think it's kind of great right now because we're talking about women in politics and how important that is to get more women. And I think it'd be kind of a cool thing to have her be a Supreme Court justice or someone who runs for office....Call MGM," she told the host Rachel Zoe. You can be expecting our calls daily.
Joke's On You
We just got another glimpse at Jared Leto's Joker from Suicide Squad on the cover of Empire's December issue . Not sure how we feel how about the sweatpants + purple leather jacket look, but you do you, Joker.
A photo posted by @riturnofdaking on Oct 26, 2015 at 8:18am PDT
